poem:
Title: In the Theatre of War 

At the fore, Biden's voice,
like ripe fruit hanging—
Strident Sanders,
red as a newly blossomed poppy,
eclipses.

A gaze on distant Gaza,
heavy with plight.
Israeli aid (or not) 
on the politician's scale—
A nickel's worth, and more.

Yet, lives tipped in concrete struggle,
in the theater of war.
Such is the human harvest, sown,
Beyond senate's gilded door.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Biden allies in Senate pile on pressure to halt Israel aid over conduct of Gaza war Hours after Joe Biden told Israel to take concrete steps to protect civilians and aid workers in Gaza or risk losing military support from the US, top Democrats ramped up pressure on the White House to go further. The progressive senator Bernie Sanders was among the strongest voices. “Israel should not be getting another nickel in military aid” until". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
